title: Why can't we have AI take over for players who dc like in HOTS and Battlerite?
body:
I on't see a point to this. It feels shitty to lose and shitty to win because someone had a dc in a game they could or should have won. It isn't fun. Riot is obviously capable of this. Why hasn't it been implemented? AFKs plague this fucking game. The AI don't even have to be good or teamfight. If you could at the bare fuckin minimum give us an ai that wards where needed (doesnt buy items unless player is clearly building something) and just afk split pushes i'd be fine with that. Its SOMETHING. 

I feel like Rioteers need to be in these kinds of games so they can get where eople are coming from. There's no advantage to this. You're a multimillion dollar company! Come on!

replies.body: I'm not sure about Battlerite, but HOTS has no items and no individual leveling up. If a teammate disconnects, the bot that replaces them will have no negative impact on the game, even if they repeatedly die. In League however, a bot repeatedly dying will feed gold to the enemy, snowballing games further. You're down a teammate, which makes a lose/lose situation, but at least you don't have a feeding bot if you keep the 4v5.

Dieing in Hots gives xp to the enemie team, so bots feeding alot would be a big issue.
The main difference with Hots is that you can give calls to the bot and say them to follow a specific player, and since teaming up and roaming around as a squad is rather effective in Hots for most maps, this prevents bots from beeing solo and getting farmed.
Also, TTK is alot lower in Hots, so it's not that easy to exploit a bot and the other 4 have tome to respond.

Still, at higher elos haveing a bot is basically gg as you can't properly teamfight vs skilled opponents which means you loose the map objectives and with that the game.
In low elo however, bots do wonders for Hots...

The xp gain is rather small compared to the gold gain
Furthermore the bot soaking xp will help its team. 
And gold a bot gets in league will do nothing for its team.

I would prefer a system in which anyone could queue up with option to act as a replacement player for Disconnected players. Ie: A player would queue up (mostly) like normal, but instead of getting into a new lobby, he would connect to an already existing game and take control of a champion whose player has disconnected.
(Edit; as a carrot, the replacement person would gain some bonus and suffer less/no penalties from defeat)

Imo bot players are easily abused and many times they would make situation worse than playing 4 vs 5 for couple of minutes.

Granted: Bot controlled champion is most likely easier for Riot to implement than this Replacement queue option.

I believe I said pretty much the same; bots are easily abused, that is why I prefer playing 4vs5 - but I would prefer a replacement Player (not bot) to take control over the DCd player over 4vs5.

The bots comment was overall for the thread sorry should have been more clear. but the rest of it is definitely towards your statement as what do we give the player who is taking over the AFK player's character in game. What is their incentive to play that game?

Sorry for the late answer, but I think my original reply had this "as a carrot, the replacement person would gain some bonus and suffer less/no penalties from defeat". And in case the replacement just trolls around, we have the report system that might get trolls punished one of these days.
That could really skew the rankings. if someone only takes these games then, they can only climb and never fall.

The AI Will just feed. I have won several 4v5 games from the very start. If AI took over, it would have fed and made the wins impossible. 

I think Riot should just put the entire team's worth of lp loss on the person who dc'd and give the other 4 players no lp loss. I have lost probably around 500 lp this season to afks. Even more to grievers, but that is a while different topic.
With how much they feed the game would be over in 15 minutes.
It's possible (highly unlikely, but possible) to win a 4v5. It is, however, impossible to win a 5v5 if one of them is a bot.
